oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Employees pouring molten iron into a cast
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Work
African American iron and steel workers; Iron and steel workers; Iron industry and trade
Iron & steel workers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This photograph shows a white and an African American employee working together to pour molten iron into a cast, likely at Wheland Foundry in Chattanooga. Wheland Foundry was formed in 1866, and made pipes, cast iron fittings, valves and hydrants. At one point, Wheland produced the brake castings and drums for nearly half of the vehicles made in North America.
